result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory Joseph Whidby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cory Joseph Whidby is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cory Joseph Whidby was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
- Report to probation no later than 12:00 PM on 5/26/22.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $243 Court Costs. Apply bond.
- $200 DNA Surcharge. Apply bond.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Department of Corrections.
- Complete Domestic Violence Assessment and follow any recommendations.

04:00 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz, DF: Cory Joseph Whidby appeared. ADA Becker recites agreement. Atty. Schlitz discusses DE's counseling completed. Court amends Ct 2 to remove modifier. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 1. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 4:31 PM. kma

Court orders:
Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct
S/W 1 year probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- Complete Domestic Violence assessment and follow any recommendations
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

Apply bond on file, balance refunded to payor.
Defendant to report to probation no later than 5/26 at 12:00 PM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

09:09 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY:  Joel David Schlitz appeared by video means, DF: Cory Joseph Whidby appeared by phone means. Atty. Misdemeanor and Criminal Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 2/17/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km
Filed by ADA Becker. mw
Pre-trial conference on February 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

AMENDED

$500 bond on file.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Deanna H. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

8:25 AM CO: SJN, RPR: Berhow, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Barry Lundeen for Joel David Schlitz appeared by video means, DF: Cory Joseph Whidby appeared. Atty. Lundeen requests modification to bond regarding no contact with victim, notes victim's request and completed Turningpoint class. State takes no position. Atty. Lundeen states that DE is in the process of DV assessment, requests modification based on victim's request. Court modifies bond regarding no contact to no abusive contact. Court sets status conference to check on progress of DE's DV assessment. Adjourned: 8:33 AM. kma  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on February 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt:
Status conference on February 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on March 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

$500 bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Deanna H. or her residence EXCEPT email regarding child visitation ONLY after 72 hour no contact has expired.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from residence in the presence of law enforcement ONE TIME ONLY.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
